data.title: Cocos Framework 3.8.1 - no windows phone solution created
data.body:
When using the Framework, a Windows phone project is not created. When using source, a Windows phone project is created. 

Forum discussion: http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/cocos-framework-3-8-1-no-windows-phone-solution-created/23997

data.title: cocos2d-x 2.2.2 jsBinding ios9闪退
data.body: SpiderMonkey compiled with incorrect page size; please update js/public/HeapAPI.h.

data.title: Android builds don't work with NDK r10 when running on Android 4.x devices
data.body:
Using cocos2d-x 3.8.1 on OSX 10.10.5.

I use android NDK `r10e` to run a Hello World autogenerated project. After I compile the project

```
cocos compile -pandroid --android-studio --no-apk
```

I and run it from android studio on Android API 17 device. The app crashes on startup. From logcat:

```
    java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: Cannot load library: soinfo_relocate(linker.cpp:975): cannot locate symbol "srand" referenced by "libcocos2dcpp.so"...
        at java.lang.Runtime.loadLibrary(Runtime.java:365)
        at java.lang.System.loadLibrary(System.java:514)
        at org.cocos2dx.lib.Cocos2dxActivity.onLoadNativeLibraries(Cocos2dxActivity.java:288)
        at org.cocos2dx.lib.Cocos2dxActivity.onCreate(Cocos2dxActivity.java:303)
        at android.app.Activity.performCreate(Activity.java:5135)
```

This thread provides some detail
http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/android-debug-mode-works-but-release-dont-crashes-at-launch/20247

In particular:

> This relates to an issue where some functions, including atof() and srand(), were static inline before android-21 but have been moved into the library .so file since then. If you compile your app against the android-21 and run it on a pre-android-21 device you will get this error.

Any way to fix this without downgrading the NDK?
Thanks.

data.title: Remove scale factor for label shadow
data.body:
Scale factor is not needed here.
It just creates differences between devices.

data.title: socket.io sending and getting data (acknowledgements)
data.body:
@himynameschris 
Is there a way to do ack with current socket.io client implementation?
This is the documentation for this : http://socket.io/docs/#sending-and-getting-data-(acknowledgements)

From socket.io js client implementation, It's just adding callback on emit function. I need this, because on slow connection, I get lost data so many times when emitting from server to client. And socket.io doesn't retry sending the lost data.

data.title: FPS (frames per second) display is incorrect when actual framerate is low
data.body:
To reproduce: 
   write a test driver to display 700 Sprite3D objects (for example, you can use cubes that are 1 unit on a side) in a three dimension grid structure, with a PointLight and ambient light enabled. To make it easier to see the FPS inconsistency, set up a simple animation, like a cube that moves a short distance in every frame. (set up an Action).

  set the animation interval to 30 fps:
    director->setAnimationInterval(1.0 / 30.0f);

On an Ipod Touch 4, it shows an fps that is obviously incorrect. The actual framerate is actually closer to 4-6 frames per second, but the fps display is showing 40+ fps. 

If you want to reproduce this issue on a faster device, keep double the 700 Sprite3D instances until you get obviously incorrect FPS numbers..

You'll see that, at a certain point, even though the fps display seems to show a high frames per second, the animation cube is moving like molasses, which indicates that the FPS display must be incorrect.

data.title: onTouchMoved() repeatedly called when there is no movement occurring
Can't get writable path on android in AppDelegate constructor
[Web Engine] Abnormal display when contains' positions change
data.body:
For example, in the third testcase in scrollView Test. 
If `setInnerContainerSize` before `setPosition` for the widget inside, there could exist a wrong judgement about whether the widget should be draw.
The reason is that we ever determined the existence of widgets in `_moveChildren`, after which the reference could get changed.

data.title: v3.8.1 android "emoji"  UserDefault setStringForKey crash
data.body:
Asus Zenfone android 5.0
1. Use edit box type some emojis, then save it by UserDefault setStringForKey CRASH
2. The same with v3.5, maybe not related to jstring2string

I know the new jstring2string fixed some UTF8,16 issue, but it cause crash.
Could you please teach me how to work around with it?
